text: Burgas Province is a province in southeastern Bulgaria. The capital city is Burgas. ==Municipalities== There are 13 municipalities in the province. The following table shows the names of each municipality, the main town or village (towns are shown in bold), and the population of each as of 2009. Municipality Pop. Town/Village Pop.Bulgarian National Statistical Institute - Bulgarian towns in 2009 Bulgarian National Statistical Institute – Bulgarian Settlements 1000–5000 inhabitants – December 2009 Aytos 30,450 Aytos 21,067 Burgas 206,343 Burgas 193,765 Kameno 12,395 Kameno 4,848 Karnobat 26,576 Karnobat 18,480 Malko Tarnovo 3,807 Malko Tarnovo 2,449 Nesebar 25,311 Nesebar 11,626 Pomorie 27,557 Pomorie 13,569 Primorsko 7,332 Primorsko 3,340 Ruen 28,217 Ruen 2,282 Sozopol 15,578 Sozopol 5,410 Sredets 16,261 Sredets 9,238 Sungurlare 13,079 Sungurlare 3,416 Tsarevo 9,413 Tsarevo 5,884 ==References== Category:Provinces of Bulgaria
title: Burgas Province
